instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
Any classics for the above? 
Posts fine.

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message: Tried another screen? Does it boot to a question mark folder with no SSD plugged in internally?

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
Not yet tried another screen.  But there is backlight. 
No question mark folder.  Will try an external monitor in the morning though .

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message: Should add that I bought this one on eBay as the seller said it had been "diagnosed" by Apple as a dead logic board.

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message: It could be a board problem, but best to try another screen first. If no success, then could be a BIOS issue

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
Thanks John 
i have a compatible display but it's on my daily driver and I'm in meetings much of the next while.  So it may be a fortnight or so before I can spare it more's the pity .

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
Do you get black, or white screen?
If no result testing known good (and compatible) screen, then come back with board model.
Then we see what to check...

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message: White screen.  Chimes and posts.  Doesn't boot from external drive or internal ssd.  It's an A1369 mid 2011.  I will pull the board later today but as per above I won't be able to test with a screen assembly for quite a while.

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
it's an 820-3023A board.  I don't have boardview and schematics for that yet so another reason for debugging to be delayed.

no orange light on charger but the fan spins, the device chimes and the CPU and PCH get warm as usual.  25v or so near the LCD.  seemingly a little low voltage on some of the coils near the CPU (around 0.5v).  When I get the schematics I will test some more and post back.

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
As this is display port, backlight with white screen should be display problem; TFT matrix is not powered.
Be sure is pure white, not the classic "dirty" white, which means image present; don't you get question mark folder?

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
I will take a photo later. No question mark folder .

​​​

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
on balance I would say it is more 'grey' than white.  but the grey of a diffused backlight?

photo here:

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
If is grey means TFT matrix is active.
Tested external video?
Did you try new BIOS with clean ME?
Also try to start from USB pendrive.

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
No luck with external video (thunderbolt)
no boot from external drive (external SSD)
No keyboard light on the shift lock. and kb backlight not illuminated

I haven't done a new bios on this type of logic board.  Is it swapping the flash chip out or do I re-flash this chip? In which case what is the process for that (on other devices, such as car flashroms, I tend to use an arduino to write via SPI but there is a probably a better/easier method for macbooks)!

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
TL866, or other available BIOS programmer.
Remove the chip is the best and safe way to do it.

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
Thanks.  

just FYI No image on known good screen. I found some time to swap them over this evening.

threads.title: MBA: Fan spin, chime, backlight no image
threads.message:
Check for USB activity.
This way you will know if board still works, or gets stuck after chime...
